src:
Nederlandsk OL-løper får lang fengselsstraff for narkotikasmugling
Den nederlandske friidrettsutøveren Madiea Ghafoor er dømt til 8,5 års fengsel for omfattende narkotikasmugling.
05 Nov 2019, 11:54 by NTB-TT
Madiea Ghafoor ble i sommer stoppet i tollen med bilen full av narkotika. Tollerne fant 50 kg ecstasy og 2 kg metamfetamin da hun skulle passere grensen fra Tyskland.
Ghafoor ble nummer fire på 400-meteren i Diamond League-stevnet i Stockholm i mai. En drøy måned senere var hun forsvunnet fra friidrettsarenaen. Tirsdag ble årsaken avslørt.
27 år gamle Ghafoor sa seg uskyldig etter tiltalen og forklarte under rettssaken at hun trodde hun transporterte dopingmateriale. Hun ville ikke fortelle hvem som sto bak transporten av narkotikaen av frykt for familiens sikkerhet.
Ghafoor deltok for Nederlands stafettlag på 4 x 400 meter under OL i 2016, og hun var i finalen på 400 meter under EM i Berlin i fjor.

text:
Dutch Olympic runner receives long prison sentence for drug smuggling
Dutch athlete Madiea Ghafoor has been sentenced to 8.5 years in prison for extensive drug smuggling.
05 Nov 2019, 11:54 PM by NTB-TT
This summer Madiea Ghafoor was stopped in the customs with the car full of drugs. Customs found 50kg of ecstasy and 2kg of methamphetamine when crossing the border from Germany.
Ghafoor finished fourth in the 400-meter Diamond League event in Stockholm in May. About a month later, she had disappeared from the athletics arena. Tuesday, the cause was revealed.
27-year-old Ghafoor was innocent after the indictment and explained during the trial that she thought she was carrying doping material. She did not want to tell who was behind the transport of the drugs for fear of family safety.
Ghafoor competed for the Dutch relay team at 4 x 400 meters during the 2016 Olympics, and she was in the final of 400 meters during the European Championships in Berlin last year.
